Subject: Re: biomass gasification: Help with reaction kinetics and modeling
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=313639478; y=8rmSXtvnLnGwUsj25IllDmGobREB030EP-9-IibWEQAgoI5t

Lorenzo,

I am also interested in the kinetics of biomass gasification and =

pyrolysis.  The biggest challenge will be coming up with a kinetic 
mechan=
ism.  Most of the mechanisms available describe combustion of 
hydrocarbons=
 and typically don't include molecules typical of biomass 
gasification (i.=
e. large oxygenated cyclic compounds).  

Cantera is a tool for modeling re=
action kinetics, but it needs input 
from the user (in the form of the kine=
tic mechanism) to tell it which 
reactions to consider and what their rates=
 are.  

If you find a mechanism that's already been developed I'd love to =

hear about it. 

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "lorenzo_damiani" 
<loren=
zo_damiani@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
> 
> I am a PhD Student, and I am working=
 on biomass gasification 
> modeling. A colleague told me about Cantera, an=
d described it as a 
> powerful device for reactors modeling: I downloaded =
it immediately!
> 
> As I am intended to implement a kinetic model for biom=
ass 
> gasification, I would like to understand what is the best way to do =

> it, and which functions may I re-utilize among the many in the 
> Canter=
a toolbox. 
> 
> The problem is: I would like to construct a 1 dimensional =
model 
able 
> to reproduce the temperature, velocity and composition profi=
les 
along 
> the axis of the reactor as the gas flows through the active s=
urface 
> of charcoal. Should I use a single reactor containing ODE solutio=
n 
> along the axial co-ordinate or should I link many 0-D reactors 
> toge=
ther?
> What about chemical reactions modeling? Mainly, the model should 
w=
ork 
> with the following reactions:
> 
> C+2H2<=3D>CH4 ; C+CO2<=3D>2CO; C+=
H2O<=3D>CO+H2; CH4+H2O<=3D>CO+3H2
> 
> Is there in the Cantera tools a kine=
tic model for these reactions?
> 
> Moreover, is there something that I can=
 use to implement a model of 
> biomass pyrolysis?
> 
> Thank you for your =
help!
> 
> Lorenzo
>
